title: How to Sow Seeds in a Box Made of Margarine Packages

steps.headline: Clean out a used small margarine container.
steps.description: Fill the margarine container with moist sowing soil suitable for the seeds you're going to grow.

steps.headline: Before proceeding, check the sizes of the containers.
steps.description: Put a big empty container over a small empty container to check that they make a good fit. Also, turn it over when slotted together, to check the air openings between the two boxes.

steps.headline: Strew the seeds on the sowing soil.
Scatter a thin layer of sowing soil over the seeds.
Put two elastic bands over the small margarine box.
steps.description: These bands prevent the top box from sliding off and also help to prevent the two boxes from slipping.

steps.headline: Put a larger margarine container upside down over the small margarine box.
To open the system, squeeze at the short sides of the big margarine container.
steps.description: Then, lift the big container off from the smaller one.

steps.headline: Check the germinating seeds regularly.
steps.description:
Add a little water when needed. After checking, put the big container back over the small one. When the first small plants are visible, stop putting the big container on. It is not needed anymore. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

text:
Clean out a used small margarine container. Fill the margarine container with moist sowing soil suitable for the seeds you're going to grow. Before proceeding, check the sizes of the containers. Put a big empty container over a small empty container to check that they make a good fit. Also, turn it over when slotted together, to check the air openings between the two boxes. Strew the seeds on the sowing soil. Scatter a thin layer of sowing soil over the seeds. Put two elastic bands over the small margarine box. These bands prevent the top box from sliding off and also help to prevent the two boxes from slipping. Put a larger margarine container upside down over the small margarine box. To open the system, squeeze at the short sides of the big margarine container. Then, lift the big container off from the smaller one. Check the germinating seeds regularly. Add a little water when needed. After checking, put the big container back over the small one. When the first small plants are visible, stop putting the big container on. It is not needed anymore. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Sow-Seeds-in-a-Box-Made-of-Margarine-Packages-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"
